bibl.title: Letter from Walter Reed to Dorsey M. McPherson, April 13, 1886

div1.p: Reed describes patients with erysipelas and double pneumonia. McPherson is to enter the Marine hospital service.

div1.head: Letter from Walter Reed to Dorsey M. McPherson, April 13, 1886
div1.p:
Your letter is just to
hand & I at once proceed to com-
ply with your request- My letter
must needs be brief as I have my
hands full of very sick patients-
A new born baby with violent
Erysipelas, & a soldier with dou-
ble Pneumonia, just for variety!
and no “medico” to whom I can so
much as say one word, for
comfort! Such is life on the fron-
tier!

Am glad that you are going
to tackle the various Boards, Civil
& otherwise. That's right, my boy,
Shake 'em up! I wish you much
success in your efforts- The Marine
Hosp. Service I have always con-
sidered a good thing- Am sorry
that I didn't go for it 5 years
ago- Washington real estate must
needs take a back seat this year,
for Florida has during the past 3
months, “yanked” something over
500 “rugged shekels” out of my
breeches' pockets! Oh! Lordy! but
its like extracting molar teeth!
Don't think my boy, that I am thorough-
ly happy, for I am not, except when
I gently reach for a $10 unwillingly
handed over by some “ranchman”.
Then life seems somewhat of a dream's

Am happy to say that wife &
babies are well- Trust that
this will find you enjoying the
same blessing!

The Lord bless you,
my boy, & bring you much happiness.
Mrs. R. joins me in kindest
regards to Mrs. McP. & yourself.
Osculate the babes for me,
& believe me, always,
